page.title: 18PARIS FARM, BREDHURST
page.content: Paris Farm consists of 175 acres (approximately 70 hectares) and is a small family concern which started in 1900. Various crops are grown, mainly cereals: oats, wheat and barley. These are grown and harvested using two tractors and two combine harvesters. The oats are used as animal feed and the wheat and barley are sold. Sheep are raised on the farm also. At the moment there are 200 ewes and 200 lambs. The owner and three helpers shear the sheep themselves and sell the wool. At one time the farm was served by a lorry which brought groceries but now the family shops at the SavaCentre, a local hypermarket and shopping centre.
